page.title: 18Transport in Maltby
page.content: 370 homes were visited in Maltby to find out what use was made of private and public transport. 75% of families owned a car,three-quarters owned one car and one seventh owned two cars. Vans,motorbikes and mopeds were owned in equal proportions. 9% of families had no vehicles. 21% of people use their cars for going to work. There were six other uses, such as taxiing,family,shopping,leisure and holidays. 52% of husbands and 34% of wives use the car. 10% of husbands and 27% of wives do not drive. If an errand of half a mile was needed 60% of husbands would use the car,while 34% would walk. Most children would walk. 58% of husbands do not use buses but those that do,use them once a day. 20% of wives,children and grandparents use buses at least once a week.
